name: The European Alliance of Companies for Energy Efficiency in Buildings
goal: The mission of EuroACE is to work together with the European institutions to help the EU move towards a more efficient use of energy in buildings, thereby contributing to European goals on job creation, economic growth, energy security and climate change.
interests: Climate Action, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Internal Market, Regional Policy
euInitiatives: EuroACE represents the interests of its members vis-à-vis EU energy efficiency policy. The main priority of EuroACE is currently the EU Climate and Energy Framework 2030, the Energy Efficiency Directive, the Governance Regulation, the Energy Performance of Buildings Directive, the 2050 Low Carbon Economy Roadmap, and the MFF post 2020.
